topics.body:
I was reading the news like I always do and I thought of something: considering how the world is getting to be a better place in say 50 years we're probably going to have people complaining about how it's "too nice of a place to live".

24/7 news is designed for people that want the spectacle of disaster rather than be informative.

What I mean by this is in the usa birth rates for the first time have gone up because 30+ year olds are having children again whereas teenage pregnancy is falling off a cliff and unplanned pregnancy is falling as well.  Call me crazy, but I have a feeling in say 10-15 years we're probably going to see people going "I miss how teens were constantly getting pregnant and marrying out of wedlock!  Times were better back then!  We didn't have any of this planned pregnancy by parents that can financially support their children!  We had rampant stds as well!  We're living in a sinful world with their low teenage pregnancy rates and low std rate!"
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
What Im Gathering is alot of cages games claim to have choices affect the story, but don't actually having a branching path. 

If that's it I guess I could see why, that would take a lot of work and pretty much require more than one story to be told. Perhaps even some where you fail outright and bad guy wins.


...actually I'd play the poop out that game

topics.author: 4fde5cee945b700a970060fc

topics.body:
"@Princess♠Molestia":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5592d4796368724a3d000d2e#post_5592d4796368724a3d000d2e
That's exactly what I would expect from a guy who says "game overs are failure of the game designer" 
But nine times out of ten, failure in his games results in the story continuing pretty much the same. And when it is different it's nothing that will effect the story in the long run. 

I want a David cage style game where one of the protagonists could just straight up die in the first failable situation and the game would still continue.

That's why produce conflict. To avoid the consequences of stagnation.

It's not bad if taken with measure but since when we've known about limitations and balance?

topics.body:
"@SeraphimDawn":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5592d6af636872537e000eba#post_5592d6af636872537e000eba

Oh there are, escapism, art, procastination among others. Thing is, they work great for an individual but the collective, that's a whole new level.

In an attempt to appease them you end up controlling them instead and their discomfort becomes yours so it's no longer about distracting them from the problems as much as have them voice your opinions even if subconsciously.

24/7 news is designed for people that want the spectacle of disaster rather than be informative.

Call me crazy, but I have a feeling in say 10-15 years we're probably going to see people going "I miss how teens were constantly getting pregnant and marrying out of wedlock!
